item.title: Spectral decomposition with Julia
item.description:
We briefly discuss how to diagonalize a symmetric square matrix into eigenvalues and eigenvectors, and some of the eigendecomposition properties.

Note about notation:

  • vectors have a bar above, like $\bar{v}$.
  • matrices have a bar below, like $\underline{A}$.
  • scalars have no bar.
  • ' means (i) the complex conjugate for scalars, or (ii) the (conjugate) transpose for vectors/matrices.
using LinearAlgebra: eigen, Diagonal, I, det, rank

Lets take a $4 \times 4$ matrix,

A = rand(4,4)

that is symmetric (or hermitic if elements were complex)

A = (A + A')/2

A $4 \times 4$ matrix has 4 eigenvalues $(e_1,e_2,e_3,e_4)$ and 4 respective eigenvectors $(\bar{v}_1,\bar{v}_2,\bar{v}_3,\bar{v}_4)$

e, U = eigen(A) # solves $A̲v̄ = ev̄$

eigen returns the eigenvalues in a vector e and the eigenvectors as columns of a matrix U. E.g. the first eigenvalue is $e_1 =$ e[1] and the first eigenvector is $\bar{v}_1 =$ U[:,1].

We can check that the secular equation $|\underline{A} - e_i\underline{I}| = 0$ is satisfied (for each eigenvalue)

for i in 1:4
   isapprox( det(A - e[i]*I), 0.00, atol=1e-4) || error("Secular equation $i not satisfied")
end

The corresponding eigenvectors satisfy $(\underline{A} - e_i\underline{I})\bar{v} = \bar{0}$

for i in 1:4
   isapprox( (A - e[i]*I)*U[:,i], fill(0.00,4), atol=1e-4) || error("a) Eigenvalue equation $i not satisfied")
end

or equivalently $\underline{A}\bar{v} = e_i\bar{v}$

for i in 1:4
   isapprox( A*U[:,i], e[i]*U[:,i], atol=1e-4) || error("b) Eigenvalue equation $i not satisfied")
end
  • If $\underline{A}$ is symmetric, thus $\underline{U}$ is orthonormal and $\underline{U}' = \underline{U}^{-1}$
  • If $\underline{A}$ is hermitic, thus $\underline{U}$ is unitary and $\underline{U}' = \underline{U}^{-1}$

In both cases it can be described as a similarity transformation $$ \underline{A} = \underline{U} \underline{D} \underline{U}^{-1} = \underline{U} \underline{D} \underline{U}' $$ where $\underline{D}$ is a diagonal matrix with the eigenvalues as diagonal elements. Therefore, $\underline{D}$ is the matrix that diagonalizes $\underline{A}$. $\underline{A}$ and $\underline{D}$ are said to be similar matrices.

A ≈ U * Diagonal(e) * U' || error("Not a similarity transformation")

A similarity transformation is also a conformal mapping. A matrix $\underline{W}$ encoding a crystallographic symmetry operation is an isometry if $$ \underline{G} \approx \underline{W} \underline{G} \underline{W}' $$ where $\underline{G}$ is the metric tensor.

item.title: Slides
item.description:
Create slides in Markdown with Wowchemy

Wowchemy | Documentation

Features

  • Efficiently write slides in Markdown
  • 3-in-1: Create, Present, and Publish your slides
  • Supports speaker notes
  • Mobile friendly slides

Controls

  • Next: Right Arrow or Space
  • Previous: Left Arrow
  • Start: Home
  • Finish: End
  • Overview: Esc
  • Speaker notes: S
  • Fullscreen: F
  • Zoom: Alt + Click
  • PDF Export: E

Code Highlighting

Inline code: variable

Code block:

porridge = "blueberry"
if porridge == "blueberry":
    print("Eating...")

Math

In-line math: $x + y = z$

Block math:

$$ f\left( x \right) = ;\frac{{2\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x - 4} \right)}}{{\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x + 1} \right)}} $$

Fragments

Make content appear incrementally

{{% fragment %}} One {{% /fragment %}}
{{% fragment %}} **Two** {{% /fragment %}}
{{% fragment %}} Three {{% /fragment %}}

Press Space to play!

One Two Three

A fragment can accept two optional parameters:

  • class: use a custom style (requires definition in custom CSS)
  • weight: sets the order in which a fragment appears

Speaker Notes

Add speaker notes to your presentation

{{% speaker_note %}}
- Only the speaker can read these notes
- Press `S` key to view
{{% /speaker_note %}}

Press the S key to view the speaker notes!

  • Only the speaker can read these notes
  • Press S key to view

Themes

  • black: Black background, white text, blue links (default)
  • white: White background, black text, blue links
  • league: Gray background, white text, blue links
  • beige: Beige background, dark text, brown links
  • sky: Blue background, thin dark text, blue links
  • night: Black background, thick white text, orange links
  • serif: Cappuccino background, gray text, brown links
  • simple: White background, black text, blue links
  • solarized: Cream-colored background, dark green text, blue links

Custom Slide

Customize the slide style and background

{{< slide background-image="/media/boards.jpg" >}}
{{< slide background-color="#0000FF" >}}
{{< slide class="my-style" >}}

Custom CSS Example

Let’s make headers navy colored.

Create assets/css/reveal_custom.css with:

.reveal section h1,
.reveal section h2,
.reveal section h3 {
  color: navy;
}
